title: About me
text:
I lead the Innovation and Development department at Espartina S.A., an Argentinian agricultural production company undergoing a deep transformation toward an AI First model. My purpose is to leverage technology, data, and artificial intelligence to create meaningful impact on decisions, processes, and people.
With a solid background in GIS, Python programming, Google Earth Engine, and PostGIS-backed database development, I design and implement innovation strategies that integrate disciplines such as geospatial data science, remote sensing, process automation, and AI-driven optimization. My focus is always on efficiency, scalability, and ensuring that solutions are truly adopted by the teams that use them.
Before stepping into my current role, I led the GIS division at Espartina, developing tools and automated workflows for managing and analyzing spatial and productive data. Prior to that, I worked as a Senior Data Analyst for Major Accounts at S4 Agtech, a Buenos Aires–based company specializing in parametric drought insurance for agriculture. In that position, I contributed to analytics workflows supporting vegetation-index-based triggers and collaborated with insurers like Munich Re and Mapfre across Argentina, Uruguay, and Brazil, combining satellite data with spatial risk modeling and parametric insurance analytics.
Beyond agriculture and technology, I have explored the applications of blockchain and cryptocurrencies in fintech and ag-tech, and I maintain a strong creative side through music. I studied jazz trumpet for several years and performed as a soloist in a professional big band. I have also played the piano since the age of six, focusing on classical, romantic, and impressionist repertoire — an artistic journey that has deeply shaped my discipline, sensitivity, and creativity.
I am an Agronomist (UBA) with postgraduate studies in Agribusiness, Data Science, and Blockchain, and I am currently pursuing a Master’s in Open Source GIS. I am passionate about continuous learning, sharing knowledge, building bridges between disciplines, and transforming complex ideas into practical, sustainable solutions.
